title: Is it a good idea to write a letter to my future boyfriend? - Quora

response.answer_text: I don’t think you’re going to like my answer. It’s not because you’re too young (mostly), it’s really not. I’d say the same thing to anyone with an idea like this. It’s a cute idea, and a nice fantasy, but that’s it. In real life, it’s just not going to happen like you may want it to. The example letter in the question details is full of big promises and commitments, and ends with a declaration of unconditional love, forever. That’s not a promise you can make, plain and simple. Especially before dating someone. Even if you were already dating someone, you couldn’t just guarantee unconditional love, flowers and chocolates every week, and perfect loyalty and selflessness. Especially not right off the bat. These things take time. So I’m sorry, but you don’t love him, and you can’t know whether you’d be able to keep any of these promises. If a girl I wasn’t dating gave me a letter like this, I’d be somewhere between awkwardly flattered, but not interested, and creeped out and completely turned away from any prospect of dating her. The whole thing reeks of clinginess and reads like wedding vows. And no way am I trying to marry someone before dating them. Most people are averse to that sort of thing. I think she should think long and hard about your ideas about relationships, and you probably shouldn’t write that letter. You don’t even know for certain if he will be you future boyfriend, for crying out loud! You can’t assume anything will just magically work out like a fairy tale, honestly. I hate to crush your hopes and dreams, but happily ever after only comes after building a relationship, from the ground up. You can’t just expect one to fall at your feet.
